title: Typeahead : No results message not displayed
body:
### Before submitting
Before submitting please make sure you have:

- updated the package to the [latest version](https://github.com/Maersk-Global/mds/releases)
- checked our [kitchen-sink](https://github.com/Maersk-Global/mds/tree/master/kitchen-sink) examples for JavaScript/framework of choice application


### Details
- package version: 1.52.1 
- link to minimal reproduction project or a code example:


### Steps to reproduce
To get this issue resolved faster please provide steps we can follow to reproduce this bug:
- Navigate to https://mds.maersk-digital.net/?path=/story/community-typeahead-default--default-story
- add value to prop `noresult` in Typeahead storybook
- Search for value `axe` in typeahead

### What is expected?
![Screenshot 2022-10-03 at 16 29 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70487054/193602823-72e0b4aa-c552-4a87-8840-8ece4f4f7c69.png)


### What is actually happening?
![Screenshot 2022-10-03 at 16 27 10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70487054/193602482-94ef453c-0d7e-4f61-89a1-1704b272260a.png)


### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here:

title: Fix Critical and High Security Vulnerabilities

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
### Before submitting
Before submitting please make sure you have:

- updated the package to the [latest version](https://github.com/Maersk-Global/mds/releases)
- checked our [kitchen-sink](https://github.com/Maersk-Global/mds/tree/master/kitchen-sink) examples for JavaScript/framework of choice application


### Details
- package version: latest , commit 0ee63ef67a0cd130804ac381606c50a4d5757251
- link to minimal reproduction project or a code example: 


### Steps to reproduce
To get this issue resolved faster please provide steps we can follow to reproduce this bug:
run `npm audit` in the terminal or enable Github dependabot in the repo to see the list of security vulnerabilities

### What is expected?
The vulnerabilities are to be fixed by upgrading packages wherever possible. 

### What is actually happening?
There are **88 vulnerabilities (1 low, 18 moderate, 62 high, 7 critical)**

title: Commodity: Add separate error message props
body:
### Describe the feature you'd like to request
Add separate error message props for server error, no results found and validation error
set default markinput and clear button

title: Clicking a focusable element inside tooltip dismisses it
body:
### Details

We have a requirement to have dismissible tags inside tooltip.
However, dismissing a tag & then clicking on tooltip content closes the tooltip.


### Steps to reproduce

Noticed the same on [MDS storybook demo](https://mds.maersk-digital.net/?path=/story/components-tooltip--tooltip&args=open:true) for tooltip with button

1.   Click on Button (or close icon for tag, in our case)
2.  Then, click on any other content inside tooltip.

![tooltip-MDS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111040734/193266755-5f34bc9a-1f43-4c6a-b6aa-14b6dd7e8109.gif)


### What is expected?

Basically, dismissing tags & clicking inside should not dismiss tooltip until cursor moves out.

![MDS-Demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111040734/193268107-035bac9a-855d-48a8-a3fa-9b7a0324607b.png)


### What is actually happening?

![Closing-tooltip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111040734/193274721-f9e51d4f-104d-41c5-aff7-02b5777a44c9.gif)

title: [Feature request] - Community typeahead support for a display label
body:
### Describe the feature you'd like to request
I am currently working with a component from "@maersk/vue-typeahead"; 
The current community Typeahead is lacking a feature that would allow me to use it instead.

Within the options property which is used to populate the dropdown I need for objects to have a label and a value property. 

This is useful for when you would like to have a nice presentation in the view, while maintaining the value you need in the code. 

- When the dropdown is searched it is searched by label.
- When an option is selected the events returns the full object. 
- When an option is selected the input field should be populated with the label and not the value.

<hr>

![ff](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93707831/193221845-5b0b187b-0473-4a2b-af88-24b66ed1d019.png)

<hr>

![ff2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93707831/193222008-e494b62d-5e4b-4c2f-8785-fabb07c311dd.png)

### Details

title: mc-c-table Component - rowselector checkbox triggering two "rowclick" events
body:
### Details
- package version: 1.51.1
- link to minimal reproduction project or a code example:
- **NOTE:** Vue 3


### Steps to reproduce
Create a Table component with a `rowselector` and use both events from component - `rowclick` and `rowselectchange`, like in below example:
`    <mc-c-table
        :columns.prop="columns"
        :data.prop="rows"
        datakey="id"
        :customstyles="customstyles"
        rowselector
        stickyrowselector
        @rowclick="onRowClick"
        @rowselectchange="onSelected"
    ></mc-c-table>`

Within `onSelected` funciton you can just print a selected row to the console:

`function onSelected(row: CustomEvent) {
  console.log(row);
}`

Observe the console output.

### What is expected?
To have only one object printed to the console, an actual `CustomEvent` object with a `type = 'rowselectchange'`.
Actually, to have only `rowselectchange` event to be emitted, without `rowclick`.

### What is actually happening?
3 `CustomEvent` objects are being printed to the console, 2 of them with a `type = 'rowclick'` and 1 with a  `type = 'rowselectchange'`.

### Additional context
Also, is it possible to have a column that is being clicked ? 
If the table has a column with a button, on `rowclick` event is not possible to distinguish if the button in the column is clicked or any other "non-clickable" column in specific row...

- link to minimal reproduction project or a code example:
Icons are not loading here: https://scm-dev.maersk.com/component-guide?path=/story/mds-community-library-scm-components-filter-card--card


### Steps to reproduce
The icons are not loading under the filter card component here: https://scm-dev.maersk.com/component-guide?path=/story/mds-community-library-scm-components-filter-card--card

### What is expected?
All the mds components load fine

### What is actually happening?
SCM bundles lit on every package and that apparently causing multiple instances of lit being presented on the page and that would break the components.

title: Origin/fix/accordion
body:
## What kind of change does this PR introduce? (put an "x" inside the square brackets and delete any whitespace)

- [ ] Feat - new features or enhancements to existing components
- [ ] Bugfix - bug or hotfix
- [ ] Refactor - refactoring code
- [ ] Chore - changes that do not modify src or test files
- [ ] Docs - changes to the documentation(storybook or README)
- [ ] Release - for releasing packages to NPM repos
- [ ] Other, please describe:  

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? (check one)

- [ ] Yes  
- [ ] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

## The PR fulfils these requirements:

- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title and linked in the description [see GitHub docs](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword)

title: Tag MultiSelect - selected options should not display under typeahead suggestions
body:
When we select an option from suggestions list or if some options are already pre-selected, then those options should not be shown under suggestions list, they can appear back only after close icon is clicked on the tag. This is how it is currently used in booking application and is inline with UX (Halei Liu).

Please refer this url, this functionality was implemented in repo vue-community-components - https://cdt.maersk.com/sharedvue/?path=/story/packages-vue-typeahead-typeahead--basic

Under Input props tab -> Allow Multi Selection - true
Under Drop-down options tab -> The key to be used for loose comparison - cityName

title: Make it possible for the content in the mc-tab-bar panel slot to overflow
body:
I would like it to be possible to use the tab-bar component so that when the content of the tab overflows, then I can scroll only the content. In this way, the tab-list would stay always in the same position and only the content of the tab would scroll.

This could be a property in the tab-bar component (e.g. sticky).

The image below shows what I'm trying to accomplish with this:

This requires further research before any work is undertaken.

The compact variant would be similar to the "plain" variant but without the padding/spacing.

For the [Tag](https://designsystem.maersk.com/components/tag/index.html) and [Notification](https://designsystem.maersk.com/components/notification/index.html) components to be configurable to accept a custom colour appearance over the pre-defined "info, success, warning, error, default".

Need to consider:

- Foreground
- Background

title: Advanced data-grid (AgGrid)
body:
## Summary

A component to support advanced presentation and manipulation of tabular data.

## Description

The datagrid goes above and beyond the functionality of the [table](https://designsystem.maersk.com/components/community/table/index.html) component in that it adds many advanced display features and allows the user to perform advanced data manipulation, meaning that they can interact with and modify the data within the grid. Whereas the purpose of the basic HTML table is simply to display tabular data in a consumable format, the datagrid serves as a tool allowing the user to manage the items that the data represents, e.g. containers or documents.

## Research

Can be found in this [Confluence article](<https://maersk-tools.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DESSYS/pages/118913114013/Basic+HTML+table+research#BasicHTMLtableresearch-3.Advancedtable(datagrid,spreadsheet)>)

[[[scm]]]

title: Label component with slot option
body:
### Summary

A custom label component that is used in all our form elements components (like: input, switch, radio, checkbox, etc.), where label can be passed as slot with more advanced html for passing icons or links.

Would need to consider:

- Accessibility when passing label as slot
- Reusability - we should be able to reuse the same label component in all our form elements
- How to integrate label in field set scenario with legend

title: Data Visualisation - recommended dev library and supporting styles
body:
### Summary
To have a recommended data visualisation / charting library approved by the front-end CoP with supporting styles.

Current the MDS website uses [ChartJS](https://www.chartjs.org/) in the [Data Visualisation guidelines](https://designsystem.maersk.com/guidelines/data-visualisation/index.html).

title: Pass slot as header in a Modal component
body:
### Summary

A header in the modal should have an option to be passed as slot, i.e. user wants to show filter options in the header and make them sticky.

title: Multi-select
body:
### Summary

An advanced selection control allowing the user to select multiple options from a list as well as filter the list and manage the selected options.

### Description
This component is already widely used across Maersk, often in the context of selecting one or more locations to filter a long list of results. Being a combination of multiple components with many states and interactions it is a rather complex component. These are some of the aspects that need to be taken into account:
- The user should be able to pick one or more options within the list (select / checkboxes)
- The user should be able to manually type to filter the list of options (autocomplete)
- The user should be able to get an overview of the chosen options at any given time (tags)
- Alternatively the user should at least be able to see the amount of chosen options at any given time
- The user should be able to easily deselect any of the chosen options
- The user should be able to entirely clear their selection (clear button)
- The user could be able to select/deselect all options
- The user could be able to see the options within groups which could be expandable/collapsible (nested options)
- The user could be able to see icons representing each option
- The user could be able to see secondary information relating to each option (subtext)

### Research

- [Research in Confluence](https://maersk-tools.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DESSYS/pages/181540913379/Multi-select+research)

### Relevant sources

- [NNGroup - Listboxes vs. Dropdown Lists](https://www.nngroup.com/articles/listbox-dropdown/)
- [Zina Szőgyényi - Improving the usability of multi-selecting from a long list](https://medium.com/tripaneer-techblog/improving-the-usability-of-multi-selecting-from-a-long-list-63e1a67aab35)
- [Vasudha Mamtani - Checkboxes vs multi-select dropdown — A comparative study](https://uxplanet.org/checkboxes-vs-multi-select-dropdown-a-comparative-study-f4c8876a7fe4)
- [Dribble - Multiselect (ideation examples)](https://dribbble.com/tags/multiselect)

![multi-select-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70192035/188461690-f10b4e5a-f7aa-427e-bb3c-b2edb84b44bf.png)
![multi-select-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70192035/188461693-1589183a-89e5-4c83-b321-f815c674498f.png)
![multi-select-3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70192035/188461698-5c2d5999-1b4c-4a6c-835e-069507839951.png)

title: Progress indicator
body:
### Summary

To indicate visually along a bar a progress based on max and value numbers e.g.

[https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_progress.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_progress.asp)

### Also from @lukas-kalcok-maersk 

I would like if the loader bar can show the exact value. I'm interested in showing the exact value. It can be a value from 0 to 1.
0 means that 0% of the loader is filled. 0.5 means that 50% of loader is filled and so on.

#### Reasoning:
Currently we have some operations that take more than 10 seconds to perform. We do know that we have for example 20 operations and 14 of them has already been processed. It would be nice if we can show this progress to user.

#### Something like this:
[Determinate progress-bar](https://material.angular.io/components/progress-bar/overview)

title: Button group / segmented controls
body:
### Summary
A segmented control is a linear set of two or more segments, each of which functions as a button. 

- Users should be able to interact with the component using a keyboard 
- Each segment (buttons) has respective ARIA labels 
- Like buttons, each segment can contain an image or icon to the left or right of the label

Also consider:

- Spacing between buttons
- Ability to align buttons "next to / touching" each other
- Orientation (vertical / horizontal)
- Ability to represent an underlying radio button group (this could be another component)

title: Time picker
body:
### Summary

Allows the user to specify a time of day in hours and minutes.

### Description

Things to consider:

- The time format should follow the general [date and time](https://designsystem.maersk.com/guidelines/date-and-time/index.html) guidelines
- Time zones may have to be taken into consideration
- Addition to input date component

## Inspiration from other design systems / libraries

- [Material](https://material.io/components/time-pickers)
- [Carbon](https://carbondesignsystem.com/components/date-picker/usage/#time-pickers)
- [Lightning](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/timepicker/)

title: Toast
body:
### Summary

A small text box to appear at the bottom of the screen. The behavior seems like a piece of bread emerging from a toaster.

### Other design systems

- [Material](https://material.io/components/snackbars)
- [Lightning](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/toast/)
- [Polaris](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/feedback-indicators/toast#navigation)

title: Figma chart library
body:
### Summary

Research and recommend a chart plugin for Figma to support [data visualisation](https://designsystem.maersk.com/guidelines/data-visualisation/index.html).

### Description

As part of the DataViz working group initiative we'd like to provide concrete tools to help out designers create clear and consistent charts which comply with our [Chart style guide](https://designsystem.maersk.com/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-style-guide/index.html) 'out of the box'. This could be made possible by providing access and instructions to a Figma plugin. We need to figure out which plugin is best suited for our needs and how we make it available to the Design Community of Practice.

### Research

- [Plugins comparison in Confluence](https://maersk-tools.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DESSYS/pages/181570307574/DataViz+Plugins+for+Figma)

title: Capitalisation
body:
### Summary

Guidelines on how text should be capitalised in various UI elements, e.g. page titles & button labels.

### Description

As a user of the design system, I would like to know which capitalisation rules I should follow e.g. title case or sentence case. For background see conversation add in the comment section below.

On Brand Central it says: "The headline should always be set in lowercase Maersk Headline Light, and at the same point size."

This indicates that Corporate Branding suggests sentence case capitalisation for headlines, but it is not clear if other texts also should use sentence case capitalisation and if there are any expectations?

The goal is to align with Corporate Branding on a set of capitalisation rules that can be added both on Brand Central and the Design System Website.

Just for clarification: What is the difference between sentence case and title case?

Title Case and Sentence Case Capitalisation in APA Style. APA's title case refers to a capitalisation style in which most words are capitalised, and sentence case refers to a capitalisation style in which most words are lowercased. In both cases, proper nouns and certain other types of words are always capitalised

See [IBM Carbon](https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/guidelines/content/writing-style) for guideline example

### Acceptance Criteria

- Best practice research in Confluence
- Guidelines written with Dos and Don’ts
- Reach out to a few in the community for validation that this make sense
- Published to website

title: Data visualisation, chart type detail pages
body:
## Summary

Content (sub)pages on the Maersk Design System website with detailed descriptions of each chart type along with usage examples.

### Description

As part of the next iteration on the [Data Visualisation Guidelines](https://designsystem.maersk.com/guidelines/data-visualisation/index.html) we'd like to provide some extra details on each chart type along with inspirational examples for how to use them in practice.

### Research

Can be found on the ['Data Viz Guidelines' Miro board](https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_l02bVBM=/?moveToWidget=3074457366329657631&cot=14)

### Follow the progress

The content is taking shape on the ['Data Viz Guidelines' Miro board](https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_l02bVBM=/?moveToWidget=3458764521009758279&cot=14)

[[[thomasbove,priyamohapatra]]]

title: Currency / prices
body:
### Summary

Guidelines on how to represent currency and prices in a conventional and consistent way as part of a UI.

### Description

How should we represent the prices for various products and services across Maersk and across different countries? Both in terms of pure content (text/numbers/symbols) and visual design (styling).

#### User story

- **As a** designer
- **I want** to know how to display prices
- **So that** the users are presented with prices of various products in a consistent and familiar way across maersk.com and other platforms

[[[haleiliu]]]

title: Data redaction / masking
body:
### Summary

Guidelines on how to redact (hide/obscure) sensitive user data in a responsible and consistent way.

### Description

If a UI contains sensitive personal information it should be redacted (hidden/obscured) in most cases. But how do we do that in the best way and make sure it is consistent across all digital Maersk interfaces? A common practice is to replace some part of the text string with asterisks (\*) but which part should be obscured for which types of information and how many characters can safely be left unobscured? These are some of the questions we need to answer and provide guidance on.

#### User story

- **As a** designer
- **I want** to know (when and) how to redact/mask/truncate sensitive user data
- **So that** I can do it in a (responsible and) consistent way

#### Interesting sources

- [Data format - Ant Design](https://ant.design/docs/spec/data-format#Data-Redaction)
- [Data formats - Patterns - Material Design](https://material.io/archive/guidelines/patterns/data-formats.html#data-formats-data-redaction-truncation)
- [Advanced Security Guide - Oracle](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/12.2/asoag/configuring-oracle-data-redaction-policies.html#GUID-F7682CC2-C294-46F3-A3C6-2F9FBB7ACC27)

title: Error messages
body:
### Summary

Guidelines on writing meaningful, useful, concise and consistent error messages as part of various UI elements, e.g. input fields and notifications.

### Description

How do we make sure users are timely informed of errors (either caused by their actions or the system) in a proper, constructive and professional manner?

This topic overlaps with general form validation and notification guidelines.

### Research

- [Invalid/error/danger terminology considerations](https://maersk-tools.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DESSYS/pages/118923416647/Invalid+error+danger+terminology+considerations)

title: Password
body:
### Summary

Guidelines on how to handle password entry fields with regards to redaction and user interactions.

### Description

How do we achieve the best user experience with providing a password in an input field, e.g. when logging in with a user account on [maersk.com](https://www.maersk.com). How is the password redacted and can the user toggle its visibility? If so, how? What are the industry conventions?

How do we make it easy for a user enter their password for the first time (create password) in line with the requirements?

### Topics to cover

- When to show a password confirm or not
- How and when we have a “show/hide” password
- Current recommended password complexity for customers / users
- Feedback to users on how strong their password is etc.
- Understanding of realistically how many times are customers required to enter passwords on Maersk.com experience etc. From internal app, confirmation that this is handled by MS auth.
- Possible feature: Allow the user to see the criteria for a valid password below the input field and validate them on the fly (continuously letting the user know which criteria have been met and which are still to be met)
- Possible feature: A success validation state – if an input is successfully validated after the focus leaves the field, then a success message (as opposed to an error message) is displayed below the input field (maybe a general feature for all input fields)

[[[rasmusqvistdehn]]]

title: Icon alignment with Brand Central
body:
### Summary

There is currently a delta between icons on the Maersk Design System to those in Brand Central. We need to align and synchronise the icon sets.

title: macOS colour picker
body:
### Summary

Create Apple CLR Colour Palettes which can then be imported into the Apple Colorpicker panel.

Possibly based on [MacOS .JSON to .CLR Color Palette Converter](https://github.com/IORoot/macos__json2clr--convert)

This is dependent on #782  being completed first.

title: Maps
body:
### Summary

Design, guidelines, preferred libraries etc.

title: Navigation patterns
body:
### Summary

A need to start mapping out, sharing and normalising when appropriate, navigational patterns.

title: Page layouts
body:
### Summary

A need to start mapping out, sharing and normalising when appropriate, page layouts.

title: Migrate Storybook to the MDS website
body: ### Summary One option is to use our website as the central hub for everything including developer documentations, and for that purpose we should investigate possible decommission of Storybook and use it only for developer local playground. The following considerations should be taken into account during the migration: - The website should be moved to the MDS repo. - New re-usable Vue component in the website should be created to be used for dynamic code previews which currently exists in storybook. Each example in a given component page should have a code preview button underneath, so the community can copy the code snippet of that example. - A new re-usable Vue component should be made in the website which can be used to demonstrate the api documentation of components in the website (maybe a grid?). - All the documentation on component's APIs should be created and moved to the counter part section of that component in the website using the re-usable component outlined in the other bullet point.

title: Text links officially designed and supported
body:
### Summary

Ensure that we have text link support in Figma and documented on the website.

### Description

We use links for navigation and they can be placed:

- On their own or directly after the content (standalone).
- Within a paragraph or sentence (inline).

We suggest that we support the following link variants:

**Blue**

- Standalone 1 – blue without underline (only underlined on hover)
  - An icon can be added at the start or the end of the link text to support e.g. external links
- Link button (ideally links shouldn't look like buttons and vice versa, but this is very hard to avoid in practice):
  - Option 1: Use the button component to support Link Buttons - so that a developer could use the existing Button variants as Link Buttons.
  - Option 2: Create separate button styled link components
  - We should provide clear overall guidelines on what a link is and what a button is (what they do)
    - Rule of thumb: links are for navigation and buttons are for actions
- Inline 1 – blue underlined.

**Grey/Black underlined**

- We also support a Dark/Grey underlined link variant for cases where a distinction between the "primary/main" links (blue) and "secondary/less important" links (Dark/grey) is helpful for the understanding of the UI.
- The Dark/grey underlined link can be used for standalone and inline links.

### Research

- [Research in Confluence](https://maersk-tools.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DESSYS/pages/118913109952/Text+link+Research)

title: Theming - Maersk dark appearance
body:
"Dark appearance" theme. 

Will require #782 to be complete

[[[antonellarinaudi,juliebyskovgade]]]

title: Theming - Design tokens
body:
### Summary

Design tokens describe the visual "DNA" of the Maersk Design System and themes.

Existing design tokens need to be made "consumerable" and fully supported / documented.

At the moment, anyone using the current MDS design tokens for their own solution requirements are unsupported.

title: Theming - Enhanced Maersk light palette
body:
### Summary

The current Maersk palette does not provide subtle shades which can make components such as the [Notification](https://designsystem.maersk.com/components/notification/index.html) and [Tag](https://designsystem.maersk.com/components/tag/index.html) appear "heavy".

We also need to revisit functional grey shades.

title: Theming - "wire-frame" theme
body:
### Summary

We would like to formally add and support a "wire-frame" theme.

### Description

There's a need among UX Designers in the Design CoP to create low fidelity mock-ups and prototypes. One way we could support this within our current toolset is to provide a wire-frame theme/skin that can be instantly applied to all the MDS components.

A wire-frame theme proof of concept for Figma has already been done by the MDS team. But this needs to be tested, expanded upon and made readily available to the Design CoP members.

### Figma library PoC

- Check out the initial proof of concept Figma Library here: [Wireframe foundations (ALPHA)](https://www.figma.com/file/tA88WKYWR4A225uP2ApxzH/%5BBETA%5D-Foundations-Wireframes?node-id=3%3A2)

title: CSS rem support
body:
### Summary

We strive to create better responsive and more accessible experiences that respect our users preferences and can easily adjust to different view ports. In order to do that, we initially propose to use:

- `rem` units for font sizes, which will become relative to the root element and respect user preferred browser font size
- `em` for internal paddings that should be relative to the component font size and fit
- `px` for margins between different components

### Description

We are still in the process of researching the topic and running POCs to investigate how we can provide the best, accessible and responsive components by changing units for defining sizes, paddings, margins, etc.

title: Variable font support
body:
With IE11 support ending, we will look at migrating to our new Maersk variable font for components and foundations.

From a web perspective, this bundles both Maersk Text and Maersk Headline into one WOFF2 file and also encapsulates font weight (bold, normal etc.) and style (italic) etc.

title: feat: New mc-c-location-servicemode component which adds Service Mode radio options to Location Search
body:
## What kind of change does this PR introduce? (put an "x" inside the square brackets and delete any whitespace)

- [x] Feat - new features or enhancements to existing components
- [ ] Bugfix - bug or hotfix
- [ ] Refactor - refactoring code
- [ ] Chore - changes that do not modify src or test files
- [ ] Docs - changes to the documentation(storybook or README)
- [ ] Release - for releasing packages to NPM repos
- [ ] Other, please describe:  

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? (check one)

- [ ] Yes  
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

## The PR fulfils these requirements:

- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title and linked in the description [see GitHub docs](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword)
- [ ] New/updated tests are included 
- [ ] All GitHub checks are passing

## Description/other information:
- This new component adds the Service Mode(CY/SD) options feature to the existing Location Search feature.

title: Treeview with checkbox in dropdown
body:
### Describe the feature you'd like to request
Please provide a select control to which has treeview with checkbox. It's a very much required control for multiselecting with hierarchal data

### Additional context
Please refer the image for more detail. 
![dropdown with treeview](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104484916/186596612-971bc92b-a40d-41e6-bc6b-c5d0b57f52e0.png)

title: Textarea resize control
Accordion - Need spaces betwee items and need the accordion title in bold
body:
Using the component referring to below link:
https://mds.maersk-digital.net/?path=/story/components-accordion-list--list

**REQUEST**
Need spaces between accordion items and need the accordion title in bold


Ideally the list looks too cluttered when there are more than 20 items . Would be good to have a space between the accordion items and if the title of each accordion is in BOLD /has a good background color

title: Select to support option groups
body:
In my select I'm currently have groups of the options to select. Like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/100295137/182396607-40c2b194-eb58-4d60-9a76-1c49b90a149b.png)

Would it be possible to do this grouping in MDS Select?

title: Input / form components: ability to place label next to the control
body: I'd like to have a property to configure placement of the label in regards of the control. In my current project I'd like to have it on the left side instead of top:

title: Confirmation Modal
body: ### Describe the feature you'd like to request In many applications there is a need for the user to confirm given action. An extension of the `Modal` can be used where the developer can call for ex: `window.mds.confirmAction` with predefined parameters and this will show a Modal to the user with two options. Existing implementation can be found [here](https://github.com/Maersk-Global/ui-edp/blob/main/src/components/common/ConfirmModal.vue) ### Additional context Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here:
